name: DINOSAURS

data.title: Coelophysis bauri
data.distinction: from one of the earliest known dinosaur genera

data.title: Allosaurus fragilis
data.distinction: was long thought to be unique for its concave vertebrae

data.title: Apatosaurus excelsus
data.distinction: its tail may have been used as a whip, or as a sensory organ

data.title: Barosaurus lentus
data.distinction: its name is derived from the Greek words for 'heavy' and 'lizard.'

data.title: Camarasaurus lentus
data.distinction: has hollow chambers, known as pleurocels, in its cervical vertebrae

data.title: Camptosaurus dispar
data.distinction: was initially called 'Camptonotus' (a name that had already been assigned to a cricket)

data.title: Diplodocus longus
data.distinction: named for the double-beamed chevron bones in the underside of its tail

data.title: Mamenchisaurus hochuanensis
data.distinction: known for its remarkably long neck

data.title: Ornitholestes hermanni
data.distinction: its specific name honors Adam Hermann, a preparator at the American Museum of Natural History

data.title: Stegosaurus stenops
data.distinction: known for kite-shaped plates along its back and spikes on its tail

data.title: Albertosaurus libratus
data.distinction: its genus is named for the Canadian province of Alberta

data.title: Anatotitan copei
data.distinction: exhibits one of the most striking examples of the 'duckbill' snout, common to hadrosaurs

display_template: - Some specimens grew to be {card['size']} long

detail: - lived in the Triassic period (251 - 201 million years ago)
- lived in the Jurassic period (201 - 145 million years ago)
- lived in the Cretaceous period (145 - 66 million years ago)
